definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ez Eze 29:3 serpent, dragon, sea-monster (NH id. (rare); Ar. tan=iynun, loan-word from Aram. [[תַּנִּינׇא]], taniyn0 Frä:123; Eth. taman:);—abs. ´[[ת]]: Ex 7:9 +, [[יִ֠ם]] Ez Eze 29:3, Eze 32:2 (by confusion with pl. of [[[תַּן]]]); pl. [[תַּנִּינַם]] Ge 1:21, etc.;—
dragon, as devourer (sim.) Je 51:34; ´[[עֵין הַתּ]]: Ne 2:13, near Jerus.

sea- (or river-) monster, Ge 1:21 (P); fig. Job 7:12, Ps 74:13 (i.e. Egyptains), Is 27:1, Is 51:9 (‖[[רַהַב ]], mythol. personif. of chaos); in summons to praise ´[[י]]: Ps 148:7 (‖[[תְּהׂמוֹת ]]).—Vid. Che:Ency. Bib. DRAGON Gunk:Sehöpfung 69 ff. Barton:JAOS xv. 1 (1891). 23 f.; personif. of water-spout RS:Sem. i. 161; 2nd ed. 176; cf. Gk. fish-name qu/nnov Lewy:Fremdw. 15.
